website_summaries.verdict: A solid value for the price, this bookshelf is sturdy yet portable.
pros: Owners praise the ample space for books available on this unit, and love that it is sturdy yet lightweight and can be folded up and transported
One user reported these held up to use in her classroom
cons: Some consumers thought they were less sturdy than expected, and occasional quality control issues meant missing or damaged parts for a few

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable space-saving bookshelf that you can stack for double the storage capacity.
pros: Stackable up to two units high
Made of hardwood that won't scratch or chip easily
cons: A few users have said it gets a little wobbly when filled with large, heavy books

customer_reviews.title: Might as well have been made of popsickle sticks. Fell apart in days.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently it cannot handle the weight of normal sized books. It collapsed within days of assembly. Irreparable, almost impossible to return. Do not buy. All that money up in smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford H. Low

customer_reviews.title: High quality! Love that they fold down flat!
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these bookshelves in my classroom. I love how they come together, and the fact that they fold down flat. That is very helpful if you have to switch classrooms! (Ugh!) They are very sturdy wood, so definitely worth the price! The picture I have is from when I only had two sets. I now have a third, but do not have a new picture. But you can see how nice they are from the picture! Definitely recommend! They hold a ton of books!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and functional
customer_reviews.text: Bought one white wood and one natural wood and they both look great. I think the price was reasonable. Packing provided excellent protection with plenty of Styrofoam padding, but still easy to open. Very minimal "assembly" - actually just screw in a front support leg and place the top shelf on some short pegs. Rated at 4 rather than 5 stars because the white one had a shelf support that had the screw in slightly the wrong place. I had to take out the single screw, drill a small hole adjacent to the original one and re-attach the support. 2 minute job, but if I didn't have a drill handy it would have been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: AzAlum

customer_reviews.title: This turned out to be a pretty good buy
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a pretty good buy. The only thing I didn't like was that it leans to the side a little and doesn't sit back in the corner of the wall real well. It's also a little wobbly so have to be careful on what you put on it.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Bookshelf is perfect for bathroom!
customer_reviews.text: This shelf is exactly as described. No assembly required. I'm using it in my bathroom to display towels, pictures and plants. The dimensions fit my space perfectly. Although the paint job could be better, it is fine for me and could easily be touched up. Was worried that a mantel piece may be needed but I'm happy without one. The price cannot be beat for what you get. I'm very happy with this purchase. I'll try to post a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J

customer_reviews.title: Rectangular shelf is now a rhombus
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to store my Computer reference books so they were handy near my computer desk. Setup was very simple, and I was stacking books in no time. Now, a year later, the shelf looks more like a rhombus than a square--it is racked to one side and I wonder if it will fall someday, like the Leaning Tower of Piza. I wish there were some way to tighten something to get it rectangular again. The books are still on the seriously-rhomboid shelf, but only until I can find another storage solution for my computer books.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan A

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble but will not stand stable. The front leg/foot that you need to screw in is much shorter than the others and so basically does nothing to help with stability. This piece must then be secured to the wall to provide any sort of stability so if you don’t want to put any holes in your wall, don’t buy. Right now, I’m using the 3M command strips for picture hanging to try to secure to the wall and it stands slightly more stable, but then I also have nothing of substantial weight on it either. Just a light 4x6 picture and frame. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sunrise007

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have gotten a number of these stacking book case from a well known retail store. Just received two from amazon. They are just as sturdy and the others I have gotten. As to all of the reviews about them not being sturdy, I just don't get it. Put big and heavy books on the bottom 2 shelves and there is no problem. So, go ahead and order them if you have been thinking about it. Just use common sense and if you have children, use the wall brackets that are included. To top it off, these are very nice looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Vicster

customer_reviews.title: Provides storage in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought at least a dozen of similar folding shelf units over the years, with usually good to excellent results. These units, while usable, and filling a need for storage, are not as sturdy as past purchases. They are serviceable, and I was glad to find them, but was disappointed at how much movement was present with the shelves dropped into place. On a 1-10 scale, I'd give these a 6.5. Will I order again, possibly, as this product can be made moveable with a little work by using wooden furniture dollys.
customer_reviews.author: hipower

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful - No Assembly Required!
customer_reviews.text: My husband's favorite words - No Assembly Required! I have been buying these kinds of book cabinets (I don't use it for books) for years. I was a widow for 15 years - and I bought several of these to use in my home. You just open and fold out - and instant shelving! Wonderful. They are beautifully made and the easiest thing to use. And you have your space finished - as soon as you take it out of the box! The hardest part is getting the box inside your house. Then it's a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and NO Assembly Required.
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful bookshelves, with a nice finish. Open the box; remove the packing; and the shelves slip right into place. I have, thus far, ordered over 20 of these shelves, for both my home library and my church's library. At the church, I stacked them two together. They are sturdy. Of the over 20 I ordered, only one had a small mark which, when the books were placed, was not noticeable. Great item for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon

customer_reviews.title: I hate putting bookcases together
customer_reviews.text: I hate putting bookcases together. This is perfect, I bought two because I was so satisfied. Once it is out of the box just open the sides and the shelves fall into place. They come with hardware if you want to stack them and keep them extra safe. I did not stack these. I bought these for books but they really aren't bookshelves. The only issue would be for mass market sized paperbacks being too small if you wanted to push them right to the back. I'm thrilled with these!!
customer_reviews.author: Grrrrrrll

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you find all of the pieces in the box
customer_reviews.text: The set up on this was so easy, that when it comes together straight out of the box, you think it is ready to go. Was grumpy with the stability of this product until I found the wooden leg and wall mounting brackets hidden in the packaging. I am using this shelf to store 2" binders in my classroom. Without that leg brace piece the shelf falls over very easily with barely anything on it. The leg helps immensely. This item looks very nice and seems to be working well for its intended purpose. I will see how strong it is after I add paperwork to the empty binders.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Noellert

customer_reviews.title: More fragile than they look
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of shelves; they looked good so I bought two more to stack on top of the first set. One of the bottom sets buckled, shifted, dumped the top set of shelves into the stacked set to the side, ruining all four sets and dumping a few hundred books across the room. They are not easily repaired and I can't think of a way to trust them again except with nails (which would prevent me from folding up the shelves for movement in the future). A folding set that is already assembled sounds easier, but only if your luck holds out. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and NO assembly required!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what happened with the purchasers on here who complained the item they received fell apart. Mine is very sturdy. The shelves are not attached with staples, the metal bracketing is secured with screws. This was very easy to set up, the shelves fold down. No assembly required at all. Interestingly, I bought a similar folding bookcase almost 20 years ago from a discount department store which has long since gone out of business . . . this bookcase matches it almost perfectly in design and even in the color of the wood!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia P.

customer_reviews.title: As described but could be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried these would arrive broken due to so many negative reviews about damage, but I ordered two and they arrived just fine. The shelves are not as sturdy and solid as similar ones I bought 20 years ago from a major retailer, so I deducted one star. I have mine weighted down with photo albums, so I hope the shelves won't bow too much over time. Otherwise, these are very convenient and serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: clucy

customer_reviews.title: Read the specs carefully and the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I RWD the other reviews....noted the issues that were identified but I went ahead and I ordered two white units - they arrived in perfect condition - I need book shelves. The units are not suited to stack - the height is too tall for the base and becomes shaky. The individual shelves will sag at less than 20 pounds of books. I am a senior citizen and cannot rebox them to send back. These units are for light weight items only - I am using amthe pair for shoe racks and sweaters. Disappointed-
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth buying
customer_reviews.text: VERY lightweight and light capacity bookshelf. It does arrive fully assembled, but the fit and finish are poor, and the stability is even worse. Far, far too flimsy to stack even with light weight loads on the shelves. I purchased similar shelves a couple of years ago at a big box store, but this shelf was a disappointing imitation of those.
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioTgr

customer_reviews.title: mediocre quality, not made for heavy duty books... more for curios
customer_reviews.text: I liked the selling point that they are made of all wood, however, when you assemble them, they do not look like a high end wood product. They are very lightweight. Hinges show the unstained wood around them, and the hardware in general is not heavy duty. This is a light duty book shelf (I ordered 2 to stack and it is a bit precarious). I would actually call them accent shelves or something that does not imply they can hold any weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up even a man can do it
customer_reviews.text: I have used these fold open book shelves for years. But I recently moved and needed more. Well this time I had my choice of a smaller width shelf or in this case 4 shelves. I like the smaller ones because putting two together gives me the exact width I needed in two places, so of course I ordered 4 of them. They are just as nice as my original wider ones but smaller or I call them double wide and they are a little bit lighter so I can move them everywhere. Yet made just exactly the same as the wider shelves and just as well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Quick

customer_reviews.title: Economic way of handling book overflow
customer_reviews.text: We needed small, portable bookshelves to take care of our overflow of magazines and paperbacks. The bookshelves arrived on time, well packed and were very easy to put together (just open). They had an odd chemical smell to them (probably the paint) so I aired them outside for a day. This took care of it. It is stated that they are stackable but we did not do this since it would have required bracing to the wall and we want them to be movable. The shelves have been handy for magazine stacks, some hardcover books and paperbacks. I would not put anything heavier than that on them.
customer_reviews.author: Laura V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Breezy
customer_reviews.text: Legitimately the easiest piece of furniture I've ever ordered. I needed something to tuck into a corner that matched my other white wood furniture in a bedroom. I hate having to build pieces but I wasn't finding anything that worked in any of the big box stores. Queue Amazon. This corner bookcase was so EASY. All of the shelves are already installed. They are on hinges so they fold up so the shelf can fold in half for shipping (or storage). The only piece I had to "install" was the final peg that needed to be screwed on the bottom so the shelf doesn't tip forward. It's a pretty off-white color (not bright white). Super easy and super convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Melin08

customer_reviews.title: Not Sturdy, at all.
customer_reviews.text: Years ago we bought a similar bookcase - same basic design - at a big box store. That old bookcase is fairly sturdy, and has held up quite well. I was expecting this new bookcase to be about the same. It is not. This new bookcase is made from the cheapest and lightest wood they could get away with. It is also not cut to very strict tolerances, so it doesn't fit together well. Lots of gaps between pieces. Compared to the old bookcase, it is a wobbly disappointment. Definitely not worth the $50 we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Steed

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dirty and broken
customer_reviews.text: The shelf arrived with the hinge on the 3rd shelf broken. There was a brown stain across a shelf that doesn't come off with any cleaning products (I had to paint over it). The top shelf/cover was made incorrectly and did not fit on the pegs. I was in a time crunch and needed an instantly ready shelf and I ended up having to replace the hinge, drill a new hole for the top to fit, and repainting the shelf. Definitly not the quality I expected for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Comes almost fully assembled
customer_reviews.text: This little shelf unit is a great little addition to the corner of my bathroom. It comes almost fully assembled and only took about 10 minutes to get from the box on the front porch to fully stocked shelves in the bathroom. It's small so you can store little things and keep them off your counters and get organized! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it had a few scrapes and dings. They're small enough that it's not noticeable once you have things on it, but they're there on a brand new product nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand vertical
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It was well packaged, no assembly is required, and the studs on top are easily removed with a pair of pliers if you don't want/need them. Cons: It doesn't stand vertical. It sort of leans to one side. (I checked it with a level.) There's no horizontal play (which would normally be good except in this case there's no way to make it plumb). Summary: A good bookshelf for, say, as student at college, or someone that plans to move around a lot because it can be easily folded for transport. But not high end furniture for your home.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Carlson

customer_reviews.title: This bookcase feels like it will fall apart at any moment
customer_reviews.text: This bookcase feels like it will fall apart at any moment. Do not put any weight on it. At all. None. I purchased a topper separately which helped its stability a bit but it is still bad. I have another one from a different manufacturer which is very stable, so the issue is not because this bookcase is foldable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles
customer_reviews.text: I have another fold out shelf like this that’s easy and simple and cost me about $35. I bought this one for overflow books in our basement, but was surprised at how much more flimsy this one was than my other one. It wobbles about 2-3 inches to the each side when pushed on laterally. A bit expensive for how poorly constructed it seems to be. Also, it came packaged with a ton of styrofoam, which may or may not bother you, but I wish it had been folded cardboard and peanuts or packing paper. Those can at least be easily recycled.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse E.

customer_reviews.title: This item is exactly like it says it is
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I was skeptical at first because of the bad reviews, but I believe the bad reviews were fake. This item came well wrapped in Styrofoam and bubble wrap. It was well made and it is exactly like the photos! I needed it because we bought a larger TV and I lost space for nic nacks and this is perfect! Do NOT believe any of the negative reviews at all. I almost did and would have regretted missing out. This item is 11 pounds and is perfect for nic nacks. NOT for heavy books or stacking.
customer_reviews.author: JC Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Up and Away
customer_reviews.text: I placed the 4 shelf folding bookcase on the far corner of my computer work table. There I placed all my electronic gizmos (speakers, modem, Alexa, cellphone booster) up and away in the corner so I could have a clear surface (except for the monitor) for my work. As a graduate student, I have enormous amounts of research papers to read and use for my studies. I have the room to spread out the paperwork without working around gizmos and wires. The walls are white, the computer desk and work table are white, it just fits right in.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together, I was able to put it together by myself! I added this corner shelf to my Massage Studio for extra storage. Inexpensive but looks expensive, I Love the look and functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Terry LM

customer_reviews.title: Corner Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little corner stand. My only problem was the bottom shelf was broken. I never received a reply from the manufacture. I had to make repairs myself. Not worth the cost if they don't stand behind product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: was someone drunk?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these in the past and liked them so much that I ordered two more. They arrived today. One of them was the wrong color and the wrong style. The other one was not only the wrong color and the wrong style but also the wrong size. How did that happen?
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly Bookcase
customer_reviews.text: I have a bookcase similar to this and I needed another one. I purchased this it is very wobbly. I thought the construction would be sturdier. It looks terrible. As an update I want to tell you that this product is NOT worth the money. No matter what I try I can't get this thing to stand straight and it looks terrible. I can't imagine anyone trying to put another one on top of this as I believe it could be dangerous. Will never buy this product again and I suggest no one else either.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie G

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED
customer_reviews.text: This was so well packaged, there was no way it could be damaged in shipping. It arrived promptly. There is NO assembly, it's assembled. You just fold the sides out and the shelves down. It's sturdy. The shelves even have a little groove and hook to stabilize it. It was just what I wanted. I actually got it for inside my closet to put my shoes, laundry bad, etc. on to neaten things up. It is PERFECT! I really love it! This worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Just right. Definitely well built for the money. Not much more "assembly" that opening a folding table. As noted by others, the finish is definitely orangey - a color best used in a modern decor. The little middle leg that screws into the bottom is too short, but isn't really needed. I'm noting this stuff, and would give a 4.5 star if I could, but I am pleased with it. In the pics it looks like it's meant to hold light stuff - and it is. The sorta-Craftsman design is well done. The 12" on a side is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: SO NICE! NO SMELL! :)
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little shelf! Just unpack, unfold and set where you want it! It's small for my small bathroom- but just right to hold rolls of toilet paper I can reach when sitting there! ;) I put some cat statues on it, and some silk flowers on top. It's pretty and best of all, it has NO SMELL like those awful particle board shelves! I'm very happy. OH and it sets firmly flat on the floor, in spite of not having adjustable legs. Light weight too. Just perfect! :)
customer_reviews.author: shopsalot

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very wobbly....cheap wood. We have one of these from 15 years ago....solid wood, heavy, sturdy. This is a cheap imitation. Too much trouble to return and repack so we are keeping it...but unhappy with quality.
customer_reviews.author: paxhungaria

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, affordable and practical
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and very nice looking. You literally just fold it open and you are ready to go! We have purchased several of the “blue box store” style (particle board) bookshelves over the years. I will never buy those again! This bookshelf is so convenient, while still being attractive. I love that it is real wood and it feels nice and sturdy. We bought this one for my daughter’s room, but I will likely eventually replace those Swedish nightmares we bought with these too! LOL.
customer_reviews.author: MurphysLaw17

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy to put together!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well to start with this little bookcase is really cute, would go with any decor. It’s fairly well made and the easiest thing I have ever in my entire life put together. Literally you just take out of the box, set it up and unfold. Well the only problem that may exist is that it isn’t the most sturdy bookcase I’ve ever seen. I just use it for my paperbacks. If you are looking for something cute, light duty and pretty cheap.. this is a bargain!!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L. Hanberg

customer_reviews.title: Nice shelf - works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive and well made. This is being used in a camper for extra storage. I put wheels on mine so that it can be rolled out of the way. It holds those items you don't leave in the camper all the time (cameras, chargers, phone wallet, etc. and you can get to them when you want. Folds up nicely for transport. It's not balsa wood so it does weigh some if you plan on moving it around a lot. Very pleased with this shelf.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Cute Easy Practical Solution
customer_reviews.text: Easy and practical to use if you need to move a lot or just enjoy rearranging your home often but can't lift heavy. The only thing I wish were different is that you have to buy the top piece separately. Without it, it doesn't look as nice. But the price for that top finishing flat piece is about the same cost or more as the entire bookcase. So...guess I'll just have to live with how it looks without it. Still don't regret buying this though. It's a cute little quick solution.
customer_reviews.author: idealistgirl

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice inexpensive shelf.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. Sets up in seconds as it is pre-assembled. The color is a bit too red for me, I was hoping more for the natural honey oak color. It is a little bit wobbly when stacked, so I am drilling a hole in the back cross bar, and screwing it to the wall to steady it. Overall I am happy with it. Minus 1/2 star for color not as pictured, minus 1/2 star for wobble (they should pre drill a wall support hole)
customer_reviews.author: Blood, Sweat and Gears

customer_reviews.title: Casual Home 3-Shelf Folding Bookcase (14" ...
customer_reviews.text: One each flanking my large desk makes for perfect symmetry. They say NOT to stack these unless using bolts into the wall. So I just flanked my desk with one each and they look GREAT. So EASY to put ut: everything was assembled: all one had to do was let the shelves slide right into place and PRESTO! you have a gorgeous bookcase. The color of the wood was lovely too. I a great buy. I might look for more in different sizes, as these are just WONDERFUL and they look SO GOOD!!! The mission design is clean and simple, too I love these bookcases and will be ordering more!! They hold a LOT of books!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina the S.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for my NYC Daughter
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for living in small places and up stairs as they collapse for carrying up and down stairs. They are reasonably sturdy and can be stacked or used separately. I recently noticed that the TOP lid-type shelf (sold separately) was not available, which is sad because this allows the entire book shelf to have a top and to be more steady PLUS the added shelf on top can hold other items. My daughter LOVES these and that makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: JanneZack

customer_reviews.title: weak and wobbly
customer_reviews.text: we purchased these and if you are using them singly they are fine.. the trouble starts when you stack them. they are wobbly, even with the brackets they provide. They fell over and not only poured books everywhere they shattered. not a good buy for the price. the connectors for stacking the shelves are shallow AND plastic..ugh! I have since found an alternative that is less expensive and stronger... go figure that one out.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva C

customer_reviews.title: Great for when you need more storage space
customer_reviews.text: I needed more storage space in my kitchen for small canned cokes, canned vegetables and paper products. I was able to clear off a lot of counter space thanks to this shelving unit. I do not recommend putting something heavy on it though. It is easy to assemble. Just pull it out of the box, open it up, stack one one top of the other and you are good to go. You can bolt it to the wall if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Shakey With No Top Shelf
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these and while they require no assembly because they are hinged, the fit and finish is such that they don't match up with each other very well. The lack of an upper shelf with the nubs sticking out of the top gives them an unfinished look. It wouldn't be advisable to put very much weight on the shelves without bracing the unit to a wall. I will be installing a top shelf on the two units that aren't stacked. It gets a big nuthin special.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Broderick

customer_reviews.title: An okay item, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this folding, mission style bookcase would be like two I purchased years ago. It isn't nearly the same quality, although, the measurements are identical. This bookcase is a little flimsy and one of the the hinges to open one of the sides is a little crooked so when open it doesn't align perfectly with the back piece. In spite of that, it's useful - strong enough to hold DVDs and books. I wouldn't trust stacking it but okay standing alone. Not perfect but not bad enough to bother to return it. I very much like that no assembly required.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, pretty, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I know have 6 of these bookcases (in two different sizes). They're easy to set up, appear quite sturdy, and look good. Perhaps I should say: set up is a matter of folding the sides out, letting the shelves drop into place, and making sure the metal tongue is properly positioned in the grooves in the shelves. It takes about 30 seconds. The only catch is that apparently they're not making the top for the 14" ones any more. Note they're stackable, so you have to buy the top separately because you only need one top no matter how tall you stack them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: OK but fragile, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I bought many of the great old sturdy--and less costly--version of this bookcase. The two I just bought in 2017 are flimsy by comparison (e.g., pieces of wood that are nearly 1" thick on my older bookcases are only about 1/2" thick on these new ones). No wonder the new ones shouldn't be stacked! However, I still like the folding design. I think these new ones will be okay, and useful, as long as I remember that they're fragile instead of sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Gentle Reader Jill

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the first one
customer_reviews.text: Re the first narrow one: Some of the parts are warped. No effect on function but looks off. I intend to pull them into alignment and place some hidden screws. Shame as is good product.. the wood material is not first world so warps. Re the second wider one: Perfect in every way but I must leave it out in the sun and breeze for a couple days to deal with the SE Asia factory smell. Nice build on this one. I have these two in my studio half bath and the look great against a dark green wainscot. Very nice at the price.

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: They are very affordable and nice but unfortunately we just barely put books on them and the cracked and the are not very heavy we have the a different brand similar those are good but these have been horrible fell apart have bought three and 2 out of three broke never buy again listen to the reviews this is a cheap flimsy product
customer_reviews.author: Paul Aragon

customer_reviews.title: Way too wobbly to be of use
customer_reviews.text: The shelf is pretty, and came decently packed, but it’s extremely wobbly. When fully set up, the shelves wiggle both in front on the pins that hold them up, and in back on the pins that let them fold up and down. This wouldn’t be a problem except that the wooden back pieces of the shelf (the horizontal ones that are solidly attached with nails, not screws) are *also* very wobbly. Fully set up with screws tightened, the top of the shelf can wobble about an inch while the bottom stays stationary. Would not recommend, I’ll definitely be returning mine
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: ... exactly what I was looking for but still very sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I was looking for but still very sturdy and strong, gets the job done. For the most part it looks like the picture though at the same time it did not and was a bit disappointing since it was a replacement for a another person since hers fell and a piece broke while I was using it at a vendor event out of town. The color was more grainy then it looks like online so that did not help and it also had a more yellow tone to it. But none the less it works and sits level so she was okay with that
customer_reviews.author: CasSandra NightRoad

customer_reviews.title: A little rocky and I can't see how it is stackable
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the 'Casual Home' 3-Shelf "Stackable" bookcase to hold some odds and ends. It does the trick, although I made sure the heaviest stuff went on the bottom shelf. However, unless this is a top unit, there is no way it is stackable unless you want to buy brackets. My other stackables are from 'Office Depot' (sadly my local store is gone and the website no longer carries "Mission style" book cases) and they have holes and pins on the top which correspond with holes on the bottom which the 'Casual Home' lacks.
customer_reviews.author: Velobill

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous bookcase!
customer_reviews.text: WOW... what a great bookcase! Got this for a display case and it's just perfect... nothing to do but set it up and the shelves fall into place and it's ready to go! The wood is beautiful and very well made... in Thailand not China! Not using it for heavy things but think it would hold up great for heavy items. And it's all wood, not fake! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Wold buy again if I need more book storage
customer_reviews.text: No assembly required. Sides and shelves fold out. This is stackable. Made of real wood. No particle board, no cardboard and the usual junk from communist China and other parts of Asia where everything bought by Americans is now made. Looks good. Works well for what I needed --- storing books --- I'm always buying and adding more books and these units worked perfectly for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Zon is the place!Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Simple and basic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 and was not happy to see that the price dropped significantly after they had been delivered. I have several of these. They are lightweight and portable and go well with most types of decor. They tend to be a little wobbly so I would suggest either fastening them to the wall or together if you have them side by side. I have them stacked 2 x 2 and a few zip ties on the back to lash them together helped stabilize them and are hidden by the books.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first folding bookcase at K-Mart right before it went out of business and regretted not being able to buy another one. That was over 18 years ago. Then I wondered if Amazon might have something similar and bingo! The wood in the new one seems not as heavy as the first one, but it is exactly what I need and matches the first one close enough to make me happy. Believe me, when you can buy a bookcase that is already assembled yet easily transportable, snap it up. Another teacher saw my first one and she bought two herself for her room from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia N Clark

customer_reviews.title: an embarrassing gift
customer_reviews.text: bought this as a gift for someone, when I saw it I was very disappointed. The inserts that go into the top shelf do not line up. the shelf has to be fastened to the wall in order to be stable. the screw on foot that goes in the front makes the shelf lean forward. the people I gave it to, said they would make it work, but I was ashamed. the wood if it is wood feels like plastic.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Truly no assembly required
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shelf because I wanted a small shelf to store the materials we need for distance learning and working from home. The shelf is really easy to set up -- the shelves just flip down. We don't have anything really heavy on it, so I can't say that it's super-sturdy, but it seems to be. It holds all the workbooks and notebooks and devices and folders. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katya

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this shelf unit !
customer_reviews.text: This shelf arrived packaged well and in perfect condition. Once I unwrapped it, which was folded flat, and stood it up, the shelves fell right into place without me having to do another thing!. No putting together, no tools needed, easy peasey. The black shelves feel very sturdy and are now filled with hard & soft cover books along with other things the kids use for projects. You can't beat the quality at this price. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I’m redoing my bathroom and needed a small storage cabinet for a corner. The size is perfect!! So easy to situate. No assembly required except a small center peg on the last shelf. CAUTION...I leaned on it and it toppled. It’s sturdy enough to hold shampoos, small towels, etc. I highly recommend this unit if you have a corner that can use for extra shelving space.
customer_reviews.author: Judy B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect affordable bookcase without looking too cheap
customer_reviews.text: This bookcase is so awesome. It is attractive, perfect size for me, and so so easy to put together speaking as someone who hates assembly. I have recommended it to people who want a bookcase with no assembly required because the assembly was that easy for me. Probably will eventually buy another one to stack.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Cute & Functional
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little bookshelf. I even purchased the top for it. I would rate it even higher because it's cute & quite functional in our kitchen for our cookbooks & essential oils center. Th one little thing that bugs me is it lists a little to the right. If it had a bit of a backboard or wider cross members of wouldn't do this. Too bad I have such a good eye for line & balance at times. The fact that I can ignor this issue...for now...makes it a 3 & not a 5.
customer_reviews.author: "G"

customer_reviews.title: ... items from my order in January and they are good quality and nice looking worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my items from my order in January and they are good quality and nice looking worth the price. But one of the rods was broken. I would like to find out how to make contact back with Casual Home to see what I would need to do to get a replacement, since it has been several months since I received it. I should have opened and checked out the product when I received it but did not. I hope to be able to reply back and change my rating once I make contact with the company
customer_reviews.author: joy trammell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: These come assembled, so it's just a matter of picking a good spot. We stack two which requires mounting them to the wall with included screws and angles. Once they are attached, they are very sturdy, especially considering their light weight. We are very pleased with them and now have four double stacks in our home. Since we are voracious readers, we'll probably buy a few more. They are very economical.
customer_reviews.author: George Tarr

customer_reviews.title: Great 👌🏻
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The top shelf isn't sturdy for anything over a few pounds but I had my bf brace it. It will hold a small tv and we have a PlayStation under the tv. It's maybe four feet tall and a decent size. It arrived nicely shipped and it is a very nice piece. I read some bad reviews but mine came great. Like I said the top shelf just sits on there unlike the other shelves so if you want to set something on it with any weight it will need to be braced. It came pre assembled and that's what I loved the most.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, beautiful and worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy these because of the price (I bought two to stack), however now that my books are on them, these shelves are worth the price. Beautiful, real wood, sturdy construction and very stable even stacked on carpeting. It comes with a bracket to mount to the wall, but with my heavy books on the bottom shelf I didn't need it. I was hoping these were similar to the ones I have seen used for displays in stores; they are EXACTLY like the ones I have seen. Very pleased and will most likely be ordering at least two more.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Z

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive good quality folding bookshelf
customer_reviews.text: Looks Good Feels sturdy enough Easy to setup (no assembly required) Inexpensive Easy to pack up The shelves will fall when you open the bookcase so make sure to be ready to catch them or have someone else there to help you. The bookshelf will be covered in Styrofoam, my suggestion is use an air compressor and blow it off thoroughly while outside or you will get particles of Styrofoam everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: I like the shelves because that were narrow enough to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased four of these shelves and stacked two to make two tall shelves. I like the shelves because that were narrow enough to fit in my small space on either side of a window in my office. I also like the fact that they are wood an look nice. no assembly required and the reasonable price are other benefits. I wish they were a little more stable, they sway a little if you push them. I do not think they will fall over. I do need to figure out how to bracket them to the wall. I read the reviews carefully and was not surprised when they arrived. Top benefits for me size and materials.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the shelf - perfect size and very sturdy for what it is. Got the mantle top and it fit perfectly. Only problem is, one of the sides seems bent a little... Not enough for me to hassle with sending it back, but if I wanted to stack another shelf on top I would have had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jesmh4

customer_reviews.title: Negative reviews on this are too picky
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and I'm glad I purchased it. I read all of the reviews on, not just this but other corner sheves like it, and almost didn't buy it because if the negative reviews. Glad I went against my gut on this one. Went together easy and the only assembly (besides unfolding it from it's flat shipping state) were 3 things (which were included) 1. A screw in the back bottom shelf and 2. The wood peg in the bottom center (you can see it in the picture) and 3. Snapping the top on. Now, it's not going to hold a 100 lb sculpture but It was only $28 and it looks good!
customer_reviews.author: Rue

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad.....
customer_reviews.text: It's not high end furniture of course, but it serves the purpose. Couldn't have been easier to set up and put to use immediately. I bought 2 more. The mantles however were another story. Had a terrible time trying to align the predrilled holes with the pegs on the bookcase. Needed to use a towel to protect the "wood" and bang it on with a small hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Nina D.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted more storage that wasn't hard to move or install since I'm older & live alone. These shelves are great. I put them in my craft/art room to put supplies or finished canvases on to dry. They are very sturdy & look good. I didn't stack them but they come with hardware to attach to the wall for extra safety & stability. Nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Nice but beware of top shelf
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hold children's books in the guest room. From the reviews it sounded like a perfect fit for the corner. The shelf is easy to set up and looks nice. There are a couple problems: 1. It does not sit evenly on the floor (solved with a rubber foot piece underneath the middle lower bottom shelf support) 2. The top shelf comes right off - the supplied rubber nobs should work but the holes where drilled to deep so 2 do not support the top shelf. Will try a wooden dowel or glue and update as I find out if this works. Hence 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Silber

customer_reviews.title: Nice Corner Shelf But
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice corner shelf and sturdy. It went well in my tiny bathroom to hold items and give the room some life. The honey oak is a lot lighter than pictured, is the one of the reasons for 4 stars but the main reason is the toxic stench of a lacquer smell - and I mean toxic - it gave me a headache. Am thinking about putting it out in the garage or placing it on the porch just to get rid of the odor.Other than that it's a wonderful piece.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Many cracks and dents in the product.  No damage from shipping, damaged prior to
customer_reviews.text: There are obvious marks on the product from use. This product was to be NEW, which in my opinion means perfect. The package was sealed, packed well and showed no damage. The item had scratched, dents and an attempt was obviously made to repair the item with a near match colored paint. Frankly if I wasn't using it for plants, I'd return it.
customer_reviews.author: 99milesaway

customer_reviews.title: No putting together, just unfold 🙂
customer_reviews.text: I love things I don't have to put together and as I have more stuff than any two people need, I also love shelves to put all that stuff on. These are light weight, so I had no trouble carrying them. They fold down right out of the box and stacking them is easy to accomplish. I definitely recommend securing them to the wall and being cognizant of the weight limit. They look nice. I have four that are stacked in to two shelves. I am very pleased with these shelves.
customer_reviews.author: mickib

customer_reviews.title: Best small storage shelf...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best small storage shelf ever made. I have been buying this style and size shelf for many years. It's harder to find in stores now and Amazon has it in many colors. I wanted white and couldn't find it elsewhere. I love the fact that no assembly is needed. Just unwrap and drop down shelves and secure on brackets.
customer_reviews.author: savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: A cheap solution for shelving that looks nice if you own a lot of books
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two, and stacked them. We used to get them at Staples. They are a cheap way to get a 6 shelf bookcase, and if you have a lot of books... I hadn't ordered them for a while, and was reluctant after reading reviews, but they matched the earlier ones. The top has changed though, so we put the older one on top so it would match. Also, these no longer include the small metal bar to attach the two cases. it is now a bar to attach to the wall. We had to get the metal bar to attach them at Lowes. A cheap solution for shelving that looks nice if you own a lot of books.
customer_reviews.author: Mennonite Baker

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great in my House
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and the style of the bookshelf. I also like that it can be folded up if required. Slightly shaky, but I have overloaded the top shelf and haven't yet installed the hardware that connects it to the wall for stability. I'm considering adding a second unit that can be added on top of the one I already have.
customer_reviews.author: Lululyon

customer_reviews.title: ... book case shipped by Plum Struck was a very nice book case
customer_reviews.text: The Casual Home 3 book case shipped by Plum Struck was a very nice book case, not as sturdy as the 4-tier shelf but I reinforced it with a piece of wood so that it would be more stable. It would be a little more stable if designed exactly like the 4-tier shelf. The 4-tier design uses bolts and cross pieces that can be tightened to hold the sides together and make the shelf more stable. The 3-tier design uses plugs and brads or staples to hold the sides together permanently and there is no way to tighten the sides to make the shelf more sturdy. It is an interesting design and very light. Gerald
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed and looks good. The only problem is that the rear slat is too high, which to be fair is obvious in the picture, so that small/medium books fall behind it. I use it in a class room and the kids are forever pushing the books behind it by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Saul

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: These shelves look pretty good, were fairly easy to put together, and to the job. BUT I wouldn't put anything too heavy on the shelves. (Using them for books).
customer_reviews.author: Non-hockey fan

customer_reviews.title: Bookcase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bookcase for my 83 yr old mother. It arrived when I was at work; she dragged it into the house, down the hall and into her bedroom. When I arrived home, it was fully upright contained all her books. She did it all by herself. Tough lady, my Mom! It is exactly what she wanted/needed and she loves the color
customer_reviews.author: CORINNE MONTANA

customer_reviews.title: Great display for art fairs
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use for art fairs that I travel too. It's great. Easy to unfold and assemble quickly. Very sturdy for the most part. I do wish maybe there was a latch that would keep it closed when folded up but I can easily add that myself. Do be gentle with it though. I noticed last time I used it one of the holes under the shelve that hooks to the side post was busted. Probably from being moved around a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is really low, I don’t feel like it’s worth the money. The one I ordered didn’t even make it through transit (it was so fragile). I feel like most of the price it to compensate for shipping something so large and heavy, that’s the only reason I can understand the price point. Tried to upload photos, but they were removed for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: They do give you brackets to screw to a wall to keep it from tipping but that not good workmanship
customer_reviews.text: The top shelf will Collapse if you have weight near the front , it’s only held by snap down pins , now I have to add some bracket to hold it down, that seems to be the only problem, but I only have it two minutes, so done with returning items , you just need to fix things yourself, and they all get away with it , but amazon is the best with products that don’t work
customer_reviews.author: Notatoy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to hold books
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, there is no assembly to this unit, unless you want to stack them. Perfect to hold books. I have it in my study on carpeted floor and it is very sturdy. Came packaged nicely, so there was no damage. It fits all sizes of books and holds alot. I don't think I would stack them unless they were secured to the wall, but as a single unit, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Riptide

customer_reviews.title: Fair shelf
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as I have had one of these book shelves for about 15 years. So decided to get another where I could go up with the limited space I have. It is definitely not the quality of the earlier purchase many years ago even with its daily use. It is not as solid and weighs about half of the original. Probably won't buy another though I love the style of the book shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Alaria Sun

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these
customer_reviews.text: Using these in my daughters bedroom and they are loaded with kids books. They seem a tad wobbly and sway if you touch them...but they haven't fallen apart yet after almost a year. I would not recommend stacking them...they dont seem stable enough for that...but as stand alone units they look nice and hold a lot...definitely a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Catra121

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product - great price - very sturdy. I had a couple of bookcases that were falling apart (partly because I always overload them and partly because they were pressboard) that probably cost almost as much as these. These are nice blond wood which match my desk and filing cabinet. I didn't even have to screw them into the wall (I stacked four sets side by side) and they're perfect. Fit all of my books and actually have room for more. Once again Amazon rocks!
customer_reviews.author: ELISE

customer_reviews.title: Need a top shelf
customer_reviews.text: My bookcase arrived today and I like it very much. It has four black nobs on the top and I wonder if they are to hold a top shelf. If so, I would like very much to purchase one - or two - as I intend to buy another bookcase like the one I received today. If the seller could contact me I would appreciate it. Djs
customer_reviews.author: bbfan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bookshelf. No assembly required
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bookshelf. No assembly required. Just folds out. For 38 dollars I was expecting a lot less. It holds all of my biggest books with room to spare and seems to have no problems with holding the weight of them all. It's not made with the highest quality of materials but for 38 dollars were you really expecting solid one piece lumber? Highly recommended. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been searching for a shelf to put all the kids’ books on to make a little reading area. They’ve been in a big basket, and I wanted them more easily accessible. This was super simple to set up, perfect right out of the box. We’ve had it up for a few months and have no issues so far. Great little shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Overall, awful product. The paint finish looks cheap and is not smooth. It is a rough wood. Then, we had to drill our own holes to snap the top shelf on because the manufacturer did not put holes in correct spot. Now it isn’t secure and falls off even with glue. Also, does not stand without the support of being nailed to wall.total disappointment. I would return it if only I would have known the trouble it would cause and now I can’t even use it because of it’s defect and trying to salvage the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this BUT...
customer_reviews.text: It's like pressed wood! And the finish product ( on the 1st shelf ) had a in dentation. IF it wasn't for my needing it asap- I would return for another one :(
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Y. DeFroscia

customer_reviews.title: I use professionally not at home......
customer_reviews.text: I guess because I use it for craft shows and farmer's market it has broken BUT it lasted over a year and it's quite lovely and adds a touch of class to my booth. The only thing I hated was the sides opening up and cracking me in the shins! But every means to strap would break from swinging sides. I'm trying other venues for traveling shows, but I did like this! If used in home I wouldn't stack for books, it will tip unless drilled into wall. But it's lovely and made of wood!
customer_reviews.author: atasteofcreole

product_meta.title: Casual Home 3-Shelf Folding Stackable Bookcase (27.5" Wide)-Natural
product_meta.description: Color:Natural| Size:27.5" Wide| Style Name:Mission StyleSturdy and stackable, this Folding Bookcase combines durability and versatility. Three strong shelves provide ample room for storage or decoration. Need more room? Stack up to 2 bookcases high to enhance organization or free up space. Foldable design makes transportation, storage, and rearrangement a breeze. Constructed of solid wood for lasting beauty.
feature_bullets: Stack up to two (2) units high
Foldable design makes for effortless storage, transport, or rearrangement
Three (3) sturdy shelves support your belongings
Natural finish solid wood construction for increased durability and longevity with no assembly required
Dimensions: 38 inches high x 27.5 inches wide x 11.5 inches deep; Weight: 22 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
